page.title: 01POPULATION AND LIFESTYLES
page.content: Leconfield (Lachinfeld) Pronounced lek-on-field. This small village is mentioned in the 'Domesday book of 1086' listed under Yorkshire its Ridings, Wapentakes and Hundreds,the Archbishop of York-West Treding (Riding). The entry continues "St John has two bovates of land, this is a berewick of Beverley (Bevreli)". This small entry does not do justice to a peacful area such as this, the only major problem being that of the main road from Beverley to Driffield passing through. The main landcover is the village itself, the airfield and the rest is farmland. The village has a population of approximately 2000 whom mainly now live in homes recently (within 20 years) built. (Continued)
